website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight and solidly constructed crab pot, but take care that you don't crank the burner too high as it has a pretty low melting point.
pros: Comes in several sizes, from 20 quarts to 60 quarts
Made from commercial-strength 99 percent pure aluminum
Features riveted handles and a vented lid
Set includes a stock pot, steamer basket, and lid
cons: Some reports of these arriving with dents
some buyers claim that these have a tendency to melt if you really put the heat to them

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SEAFOOD BOIL POT
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these after discovering "Frogmore Stew". If you're doing any type of seafood boil this is the pot to have. I was concerned the 42 qt would be bigger than what I needed, but "size does matter". If you're using the strainer it takes up a good amount of space around the edges and bottom. I have done boil for ten using this pot and could probably squeeze in 1-2 more. It's not a heavy gauge so I am not sure I would push the limits. But for boiling water it heats up fast.
customer_reviews.author: James K. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Great quality - big big big!
customer_reviews.text: We used this with the Bayou Classic propane burner for a few shrimp boils and found it to be good quality. At 42 quarts, this is our biggest stockpot. The build quality if good and the inside basket is large. We boiled enough for 15 big eaters without any problem. Great quality I would recommend this stockpot.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this choice!
customer_reviews.text: I debated about stainless before buying this pot, but ultimately selected this one for conduction properties. That fact that it's lighter than stainless is also beneficial since I use it for large boils. I was feeling a little anal knowing it won't always be shiny & new, but am so pleased with the way it cleans up, especially when you oil the interior prior to use as directed. I expect to have this pot at the heart of many gatherings for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money spent, total disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: Received this in March 2016, specifically to steam crabs. Have only used it at most 4 times. Got it out today to steam some crabs and noticed the liquid was coming right out the bottom, so emptied and out and sure enough holes all on the bottom! I wish we had read the bad reviews before purchasing. Ridiculous for this to happen especially with such little use. Now we have live crabs ready to be steamed and no pot so now we are out scrambling to find one at a local store. Not happy and will never purchase this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Karen K.

customer_reviews.title: Great pot and holds up well
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect. I have cooked several shrimp and crab boils. Keep in mind when it is full of water and food it is super heavy. Works great on my fishfryer burner or on my stove top. Keep in mind this container is aluminum so when you usr burner you need to tun te flame lower because i have notice other reviewers burning through the aluminum buttom because they run the flam past the melting point of aluminum. Very happy with product would highly recommend. Just a side not that handles are solid and revitted on and will hold up to a ton of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jrcairtime

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Stockpot for seafood !!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for crawfish and this helps us to reduce our process to 1/2 of the time. We used this to clean the crawfish. This works perfectly with the basket. After 3 round of water, the water is crystal clean. The only thing is the material seems thinner than I expected. Hope it will last. For now, it's great !!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Mai

customer_reviews.title: The perfect size boiling pot!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect size all purpose boiling pot. I bought it for home brewing but will be using it for seafood boils, perfect size for crab or shrimp boil or about 1/2 sack of crawfish. For home brewing 5 gallon batches of beer there is plenty more room to prevent boilovers. Great product and quality made.
customer_reviews.author: L Devillier

customer_reviews.title: It works....don’t kill it with hell fire.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for me....I have seen other reviews regarding the melting point bla bla bla.....here is a hint....be patient, drink a couple extra beers it will boil! You don’t have to kill it with a space shuttle engine. Worked great for a shrimp boil that was 3/4 full. Steaming crabs would be a breeze. We will see if it holds up but seems to do well as long and you don’t put it on lava and just let it do it’s thing.
customer_reviews.author: Mski

customer_reviews.title: So we've had this for a couple of months and ...
customer_reviews.text: So we've had this for a couple of months and it's been used twice. It's already started to change color inside, and it stained everything black the first time it was used. I would suggest to boil just water with it full first prior to using it just in case. It serves its purpose but at the same time it really doesn't seem to be of premium quality.
customer_reviews.author: karen0586

customer_reviews.title: Too Large
customer_reviews.text: This product is far too large for me. The product looks to be well made, but I need one about 20-25 qts. I hate sending stuff back, but in this case I must.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This pot is perfect for feeding a decent size crowd gumbo. The thin aluminum heats fast and seems to distribute the heat evenly. The strainer basket is also good for a small shrimp or crawfish boil.
customer_reviews.author: Opie T.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome size!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after buying a smaller pot. It is awesome. You think it will be too big, but if you are doing a boil for more than 4-6 people, you really need this larger pot. I will be purchasing a second one soon.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Good basic pot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pot for beer brewing and it works great for that. Plenty of room to put in a 5 gallon batch with no worry at all about having it overflow. It is sturdy construction, the only downside I see is the lid which is a bit flimsy. Given that I didn't buy the pot for the lid I don't see it as a big deal, just something to be aware of. The metal for the rest of the pot is strong and remarkably light (none of the rest of my cookware is aluminum, strangely it may be my lightest yet biggest pot).
customer_reviews.author: Will T.

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: Used it 3 times on the bayou classic burner. On the third time the aluminum completely melted. We now have no pot and all our lobster was ruined.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Parker

customer_reviews.title: Just the RIGHT SIZE!!
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for frying our turkey on Thanksgiving this past year. Before we were using a 100 QT pot and we only used about a third of the oil this year.....Worked well for the Seafood Low boil as well.
customer_reviews.author: B Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good pot for crawfish boil
customer_reviews.text: purchased this for crawfish boil, was hoping to cook 30lbs in one pot but it only hold about 15 pounds with some potatoes, corns and shrimp. It did what is supposed to do and I plan to fry a turkey and see how it hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for thanksgiving and Christmas parties, used to cook live lobsters and crab, highly recommend, super easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Rich Thanh Pham

customer_reviews.title: Great Stockpots
customer_reviews.text: I gave these along with a gas burner to my son for Christmas. Great for stews and very easy to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for large crab legs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect pot for cooking large crab legs. Instructions to clean were a little more work than I expected
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: HUGE!!! Love the size of this pot. The basket fits in just perfectly so there isn’t a bunch of wasted space.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: Thin metal, doesn't hold up at all.
customer_reviews.text: The liquid we used (RIT Fabric Dye) and water, ate holes THROUGH the metal of this pot. Not sure if the metal is low grade, but it was very poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE QUALITY! DO NOT PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE QUALITY! DO NOT PURCHASE! Used this 3-4 times to steam crabs, noticed water leaking, found pin holes all over the pot. Then found that they only have a 30-day return window. Save your money, don't do it!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: I use this giant pot and basket for crawfish boils. The pot completely covers the standard turkey fryer burner but doesn't overlap any of the sides. The lip just on the inside of the bot allows the basket to rest a few inches off the bottom of the pot so you get even cooking throughout the basket.
customer_reviews.author: Westley Bumgarner

customer_reviews.title: Loved it, I seen some past reviews on this ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved it, I seen some past reviews on this pot and was kinda hesitant to purchase as I also purchased the bayou classic SPD2 burner which is a beast and amazing if your looking for one. But this pot is worth the monwy, we entertained for a crowd of 30, boiling over 100 crabs and crawfish, the quality is there and there were no leaks or damage with my pot. This truly is a good buy, if you compare pots at Walmart or even lowes this pot for the price and the quality is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Pogue

customer_reviews.title: Crawfish boil here I come
customer_reviews.text: I can see this pot being used for many more crawfish boils. If you buy one be certain to season the underside of the lid. I did not and you can tell.
customer_reviews.author: Khawn

customer_reviews.title: This pot was amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: This pot was amazing!!!!! I used it to cook 80lbs of shrimp for a shrimp boil, not all at the same time, and it was awesome! I used an outside burner that heated up in mere minutes. My boil would not have been a success with out this! I may buy another! Does get the black char on it from the burner, but easily washes off.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for boiling large batches of corks for my business...works great!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Wenkel

customer_reviews.title: Bayou Classic 42 Qt. Alum Steamer Pot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for steaming Maryland blue crabs, clam bakes, and to make chili. I already own a smaller Bayou Classic pot but I needed the 42 qt. for more capacity. It fits perfectly on the side burner of my grill and also fits on my kitchen stove with plenty of clearance under the exhaust hood. Exactly what I expected and made with the same quality as my smaller, older pot. Be sure to thoroughly clean the inside of the pot before using, as mine had a greasy film on the inside (especially where the handles were drilled into the pot). I highly recommend and Amazon was cheaper than my local Lowes.
customer_reviews.author: Martymar

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality
customer_reviews.text: The pot seems very cheap and flimsy. It arrived with a dent in the side and the rim of the cover dented. It's easy enough to bend the cover back into shape, but as a new product, this shouldn't have been an issue, especially given all the original packaging that it came in. They clearly shipped it in that condition. I should have read more reviews before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher LaFond

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Shrimp boil champ is what this made me during vacation. Big size and lightweight were pluses but the ease of cleaning it up was what really impressed me. Can’t wait for the next boil...this time at home.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Burton

customer_reviews.title: Very thin metal - arrived dented
customer_reviews.text: Low quality for the price - metal is very thin and dents very easily. Arrived with several dents, including a crease that had to be hammered out just to get the basket out of the pot. Have used it once for lobsters. Not sure how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Page

customer_reviews.title: Great fry pot
customer_reviews.text: Used for turkey fry, and been frying like crazy. Will need at least 5 gal oil, and this thing is huge, but well made and works very well for frying. No warping or staining, works very well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Peck

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size pot for doing a family seafood boil or ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size pot for doing a family seafood boil or whatever you need. Can do small turkey or some fish frying too. Pot and insert are high quality constructed and heats up in 15mins with the SP2 Bayou Classic SP2 Jet Burner.
customer_reviews.author: sniperkiller 187

customer_reviews.title: large crab pot
customer_reviews.text: Real thin and not very durable. Works ok but is thin and it is easy to overheat and melt. Save yourself some frustration and buy a Stainless steel pot that might last. Update, went to use this last weekend and discovered pin holes in the bottom , now its just a big beer can with no deposit. Its a piece of junk, dont buy it!
customer_reviews.author: skeetshtr

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Big enough to cook seafood boil for 10 people!!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved that I was able to cook a seafood boil for ten people all in one pot!!! Best thing I bought in a while!!
customer_reviews.author: Val B

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We massively dislike this. It is VERY thin. Just not what we thiught it was.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was Looking for
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 42 Qt steam/boil pot. its exactly what i was looking for. it arrived before the actual time stated, which was a plus. I purchased this item for a low country shrimp boil party that i was throwing for about 20 people. and the size was just right. i will also make use of it for Thanksgiving and fry a turkey this year. oh it was less expensive than my local Lowe's. thanks amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Babyblues1333

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or $
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet, but saw some loose metal in the bottom. Wiped it with my finger, and my finger was COVERED with aluminum flakes from when it was ground down. Cheaply built, never wiped down, poorly packed, from some south american country. DO NOT waste your time or money. It gets 1 star because It won't let me give it .0001
customer_reviews.author: Joy B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted something bigger and this is definitely bigger!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect for steaming seafood! This was exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great pot
customer_reviews.text: I can't wait to do a boil, very impressed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Falconstrike

customer_reviews.title: What a great set! For my money
customer_reviews.text: What a great set! For my money, this is exactly what I want. I need a pot like this only occasionally, but when I need it - I need it. This set is made of thinner aluminum, so it's not going to hold up to heavy use, but for someone that will steam crabs once in a while, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: It is thin.
customer_reviews.text: It is thin, dents easily. Probably will burn through after a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: huge
customer_reviews.text: i was worried about the size since i could not hold what i was buying i was affraid it would be too small for the crawfish boil i am having. Got it in super fast and man this baby is huge!! I almost bought the bigger one but that would have been overkill and i would need to build a room to store it in im sure. great buy i would do it again
customer_reviews.author: darren maines

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The strainer was bent and would not fit in the pot. I had to "engineer" it to make it fit for a seafood boil i was holding.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Madsen

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I used this to brew a 5 gallon batch of beer as it was cheaper than stainless and would be suitable for steaming as well. Just be sure to oxidize it first. Its not as shiny as stainless, but plenty strong and heats up quickly. There was a slight dent in the rim of the pot, but not enough to matter.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for clams, king crab, shrimp, lobsters, mussels, and oysters.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: ... 5 lobsters at once on multiple occasions and worked great everything. Basket keeps the stuff off the bottom ...
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars used this to cook 5 lobsters at once on multiple occasions and worked great everything. Basket keeps the stuff off the bottom of the pan so it isnt right on the fire and makes it easy to take out.
customer_reviews.author: Davey C

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: This pot is made with thin, low quality metal. It does not hold heat well. It discolored after a single use. And, it was warped when it arrived. I saw many reviews calling this a "study", "heavy duty" pot. That is a lie. This 42-quart pot weighs 9lbs including lid and basket. A 12 quart aluminum Calphalon pot (without a basket!) also weighs 9lbs. The Calphalon pot is 1/4 the size the same weight. This Bayou Classics pot is Bayou Cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of room for backyard seafood boil.
customer_reviews.text: Great size for a family low country boil!.... big enough for everyone to eat all they want.
customer_reviews.author: J. Negri

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for crawfish boils!
customer_reviews.text: We boiled up several hundred pounds of crawfish with this multiple times. It's a great unit. It's sturdy as heck and accompanied with the bayou classic burner it can cook up a lot of bugs. Great stuff. Would recommend to anybody (in fact, my buddies want one now).
customer_reviews.author: Fry

customer_reviews.title: Cooks great! Just have to be careful with it
customer_reviews.text: Cooks great! Just have to be careful with it; I bent mine while trying to pour out the water in it (bends back close enough, just seemed a bit too easy).
customer_reviews.author: Tylor E.

customer_reviews.title: Great for frying a turkey in
customer_reviews.text: This pot is great for outdoor cooking whether it's for a crawfish/ crab boil or for deep frying a turkey. It's large size holds some extra oil which keeps the oil temperature from falling too much when the turkey is dropped in - much better than the 30qt pot I've used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Thor Christensen, Austin, TX

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It arrived with the lid smashed and the pot was dented. Not very study and was packed wrapped up in Mexican news papers only
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my oyster roast!
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived in good shape even though I purchased at a lower price b/c it'd been re-packaged. I've only used it once (for an oyster roast) but it worked like a charm and didn't dent.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine LaFond

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pot to test it. I used it to cook crawfish and pototoes. Very excellent and great price. It wasnt cheap material or anything. Easy to wash and it cooked my food very well.
customer_reviews.author: Hang

customer_reviews.title: Light, easy to clean and sexy looking
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight yet heavy duty. Made our first low country boil the day after it arrived. :)
customer_reviews.author: Cash

customer_reviews.title: Very good product. Used to make corned Beef for st ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Used to make corned Beef for st paddys in a restaurant. Held up and cleaned up well.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Well made product that I would recommend highly to anyone needing a good pot for boils.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Meyers

customer_reviews.title: large waste of time
customer_reviews.text: Paper thin aluminum arrived dented and cracked. Had to send it back, large waste of time. Amazon did a great job of standing behind it, and credited the charges.
customer_reviews.author: Gtcoupe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We've used this for two oyster roasts and it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Laurel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of cooking all the crab I catch 2 at a time in the kitchen, not to mention it makes the house smell like s***. I use this outside with a burner now and it's much faster and easier.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: crab boil pot
customer_reviews.text: we used this for a crab boil and it was everything we hoped for awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for those seafood boils. Cheap so don't worry about beating it up.
customer_reviews.author: David E.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal!
customer_reviews.text: Great pot! Used it for a crawfish boil this weekend and that basket was so helpful!
customer_reviews.author: ArizonaMamaof2

customer_reviews.title: Big size, but not the best pot ever
customer_reviews.text: Despite it's size, the pot is very light and feels like it is made from aluminum. It dents like a tin can. It did not register on my induction burner. I've brewed beer and done a crab boil using it. For both of those purposes, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Hills

customer_reviews.title: Its a pot
customer_reviews.text: Works great, big capacity. Only used it once so far for a crab boil. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: MNAlan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my first crawfish boil and now I want to continue hosting boils! Super easy and good way to keep the kitchen clean when hosting a bunch of people.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Quality is good for the price point
customer_reviews.text: This is a HUGE pot - could use it as a back up bath tub for my kids. I fried two 16 lb turkeys together in this with room left over. Quality is good for the price point. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Roberts

customer_reviews.title: What a great buy
customer_reviews.text: What a great buy for the cook in your family. My son-in-law is the cook in their family and asked for one of these for Christmas. It is well made and an excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnne Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: I finally got to boil Dungy crab in this perfect sized pot. I cooked 10 crab and could have added another 6 no problem....Works great..heats fast. I can't wait for the crawdad boil this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Morgan

customer_reviews.title: 44 qt steam boil
customer_reviews.text: Pot seems tad thin but it will do I guess. Nothing like the old days. Havent used it yet but if it grts the pinhole issue you can bet I be calling company.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Aluminum is very thin
customer_reviews.text: This pot is very thin and arrived with a large dent that occurred during shipping. I am surprised at all of these positive reviews considering how thin the aluminum is. You could dent/bend this with your bare hands with little effort. I am returned it and have replaced it with a 40qt Winware aluminum stock pot (basket and top are available but sold separately). The Winware pot is much higher quality and the aluminum is at least twice as thick. Although it is a little more expensive it will not be easily damage and is sill a very good value.
customer_reviews.author: BrandoB

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good size pot. I have used it to make wings and boils. It fits so much food which helps when you are trying to feed a lot of people. It also heats up quickly which is great for me.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: This was a gift and was very nice but it did arrive with a dent in the ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and was very nice but it did arrive with a dent in the side of the pot which was embarrassing to be giving as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! Returned because needed the whole kit. But recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality / Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit along with a propane burner/stand and am impressed with the finish and quality. The lid and steamer basket are all machined well with no burrs. Rivets are sturdy and the unit is built to stand the test of time. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a LARGE pot for parties, clam bakes or the like. Not small (42qt) by any means, but if you're cooking for a small army, this will work well! Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Neoperk

customer_reviews.title: SUPERB
customer_reviews.text: My party went off without a hitch. It was too small but thats only because I had too many mouths. I love my stock pot. I have used it several times I can wait to pull it out again
customer_reviews.author: Damourude

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Received with a dent but overall product performs as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Scott

customer_reviews.title: Worked great! Great price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a clambake that I had this summer. Worked great! Great price.
customer_reviews.author: ab16

customer_reviews.title: Heats quickly but also dents and scratches easily.
customer_reviews.text: Very thin material. Heats quickly but also dents and scratches easily.
customer_reviews.author: kimski

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: have used it five times now. definitely oil it before use, makes it easier to clean. i was able to fit 15 pounds of crawfish in here no problem
customer_reviews.author: captChris

customer_reviews.title: you can fry a turkey in one of these bad boys! A great purchase
customer_reviews.text: YES, you can fry a turkey in one of these bad boys! A great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bill & Kate Lamey

customer_reviews.title: Good for home brew
customer_reviews.text: Works great for home brewing, and the occasional lobster bake.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love my new pot. It will come in handy for steaming crabs or cooking stuffed ham.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Biscoe

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pot
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for low country shrimp boil. Was the talk of party for it's size and quality. Looking forward to using for clam bake lobster boil.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a reception dinner to make shrimp boil.
customer_reviews.author: Loulie

customer_reviews.title: If your into out door cooking you have to have this!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used it 3 time already. Lobsters, clams, mussels and a clam bake. Works great!! Could have been packaged better. Pot has a small ding on the side.
customer_reviews.author: The Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This pot is very sturdy excellent for a crawfish boil!!
customer_reviews.author: brwsuga

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: had a great seafood feast. Crab legs were too long, just broke at joint.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: dont buy this
customer_reviews.text: I used this pot 2 times and it started leaking water from little tiny piholes in the side. VERY poorly made, junk material, you will be very sorry with this purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I wish it was a little heavier grade, but it's heavy enough and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pot and basket
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I purchased this product to haul around in my RV. Never know when I might get hungry for crawfish.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: The right crab pot
customer_reviews.text: This item is well made and the pot was large enough to fit a half bushel of crabs and some ears of corn
customer_reviews.author: Konosuba

customer_reviews.title: Cooked well and enjoyed the crab legs
customer_reviews.text: Worked great! We did a crab broil for Christmas and it held up perfectly! And the food was good too.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brazziel

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this for my home brewing kettle. It works great as I do the brew-in-a-bag method, so the strainer basket keeps the bag from touching the bottom and burning or melting and it also gives the bag support especially when removing the bag and draining.
customer_reviews.author: Sean S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for cajun boils. The steam and boil basket makes it easy to get the food to the table easily.
customer_reviews.author: campergirl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Really awesome stockpot. Upgraded from a very small 20 something oz stockpot that couldn't close all the way and took forever to heat up and boil the water. Used it this past weekend to cook 110 lbs of crawfish and this stockpot held up like a champ. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Random Guy

customer_reviews.title: Pot and basket ok
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived with lid bent. Lid made of thin material easily bent so don't drop it or edge will bend. Towel and some finger and elbow grease will allow you straighten for use. Pot and basket are ok.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Newton

customer_reviews.title: it was a perfect item i had to send it back was just to big...
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT POT!!!! BUT HAD TO SEND BACK IT WAS JUST Way to big for us, got a smaller one.. Shipped fast and was was everthing it said it was.
customer_reviews.author: Carrol

product_meta.title: Bayou Classic 4042 42-Quart All-Purpose Aluminum Stockpot with Steam and Boil Basket
product_meta.description: Size:42 quartThis all-purpose stockpot is the perfect addition to any cooking environment indoors or outdoors! The steam-boil-fry stockpot has an indentation that raises the basket 1. 75" Above the bottom for steaming or boiling. Use the basket to deep fry chic
feature_bullets: 42-quart stockpot with basket for steaming and broiling
Vented lid for even cooking; heavy duty riveted handles
Stock pot basket sets 3.25 inches above bottom for steaming
Basket detaches for boiling pasta, soups, stews, gumbo
